meanings.definition: Touching or meeting at a point
meanings.sent1: The two lines were osculant at the tip.
meanings.sent2: The osculant circles shared a common point.
meanings.sent3: The osculant triangles seemed to be best friends.
meanings.sent4: Their ideas were osculant, converging towards a common goal.
meanings.sent5: The osculant stars in the sky formed a perfect alignment.

meanings.definition: A point of tangency between two curves
meanings.sent1: The osculant of the parabolas marked their intersection.
meanings.sent2: The osculant of the circles showed where they touched.
meanings.sent3: The osculant of the curves looked like a secret meeting point.
meanings.sent4: At the osculant of the waves, they seemed to merge seamlessly.
meanings.sent5: The osculant of the paths guided them towards each other.

meanings.definition: A point of contact between two surfaces
meanings.sent1: The osculant of the spheres indicated their connection.
meanings.sent2: The osculant of the boxes showed where they met.
meanings.sent3: The osculant of the walls seemed to be gossiping.
meanings.sent4: At the osculant of the cliffs, the climbers met their challenge.
meanings.sent5: The osculant of the roads led to a crossroads.
